page.title: 14LAW & ORDER
page.content: This area can be divided into the USAF Base, Woodbridge, and the larger tract of forest and farmland with a few scattered houses. Everyone, Americans and British, live under the protection of British Law and the British Police. American Security Police operate at the Base, and a British policeman is stationed there as a Liaison Officer. A British Legal Adviser serves there also. Offences arise which are common to any community,such as road traffic, drugs and occasional rowdiness - all being dealt with in British Courts. At times campers try to stay overnight on Forest land, a practice disallowed by the Commission's Bye-Laws. Farmers are sometimes annoyed by horse-riders' disregard for crops, but both Police Forces recognise this area as one which poses few problems of real crime.
